title: Yevgeny Primakov obituary | Russia | The Guardian

quotes: In May 1999 Yeltsin sacked him as PM.
which swept into the lead in opinion polls before the Duma elections that December.
Primakov’s star faded and in February 2000 he withdrew from the presidential race, which Putin won easily.
In 2001 the new president gave Primakov a soft job as chairman of the Russian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, a position he held until 2011.

organizations.name: ORT
quotes: Berezovsky’s TV station, ORT, launched a furious demonisation of Primakov, claiming he was a puppet of the communists and too old at 70 to be a proper president.

organizations.name: Nato
quotes: The decision was hailed in the Russian media as a dramatic sign that Russia had restored its independence and would not condone US violations of international law for the sake of cash.

roles.title: prime minister
quotes: Chosen as prime minister, Primakov appointed communists as well as reformers to his cabinet and started a policy of quantitative easing, pumping money to enterprises to pay wages which had been stopped, hire more staff, and revive investment.

roles.title: mayor of Moscow
quotes: forming an electoral alliance with Yuri Luzhkov, the mayor of Moscow, called Fatherland-All Russia, which swept into the lead in opinion polls before the Duma elections that December.
Flying to Washington for talks on a new American loan, he was rung by the vice-president, Al Gore, and told that Nato bombing had begun.
The decision was hailed in the Russian media as a dramatic sign that Russia had restored its independence and would not condone US violations of international law for the sake of cash.
At the same time the Kremlin launched a new war in Chechnya, allowing Putin, freshly installed as PM, to argue that the country needed someone young and strong to take charge.
Yeltsin was worried that Primakov was becoming the most popular politician in Russia, with a real chance of winning the presidential election the next year.
